1.text: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest; so honor is not seemly for a fool.

2.text: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

3.text: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the foolâ€™s back.

4.text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like him.

5.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

6.text: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.

7.text: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

8.text: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honor to a fool.

9.text: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

10.text: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.

11.text: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.

12.text: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

13.text: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

14.text: As the door turneth upon its hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.

15.text: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.

16.text: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

17.text: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

18.text: As a mad man who casteth fire-brands, arrows, and death,

19.text: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbor, and saith, Am not I in sport?

20.text: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no tale-bearer, the strife ceaseth.

21.text: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

22.text: The words of a tale-bearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

23.text: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

24.text: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;

25.text: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.

26.text: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shown before the whole congregation.

27.text: Whoever diggeth a pit shall fall into it: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

28.text: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
